title: How to Prepare Wax with Sugar

steps.title: Place a medium-sized pot on the stove.
steps.content: Place a medium-sized pot on the stove. Even though this recipe makes a fairly small batch of sugar wax (approximately enough for 2 legs), use a medium or large pot to make it. The mixture starts to bubble when you heat it, and it can overflow if you use a small pot.

steps.title: Add the white sugar, lemon juice, and warm water to the pot.
steps.content: Add the white sugar, lemon juice, and warm water to the pot. Measure out the granulated white sugar and dump it into the pot. Then add the lemon juice and warm water. Stir to combine them. [2] X Research source Use white or brown granulated sugar. Powdered sugar won't work at all.

steps.title: Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat.
steps.content: Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Turn your burner on high and let the mixture heat up until it starts to boil. Stir frequently. Keep an eye on the mixture, since it will start to bubble as it heats up. [3] X Research source Take care not to burn the mixture. If you do, it will completely solidify once it cools down, making it unusable.

steps.title: Reduce the heat to medium.
steps.content: Reduce the heat to medium. Once the mixture starts bubbling and boiling, turn the heat down to medium. Continue to stir frequently. The sugar should be completely dissolved in the liquid at this point. [4] X Research source If the mixture continues to bubble rapidly at medium heat, turn it down to low.

steps.title: Remove the pot from heat when the mixture turns golden brown.
steps.content: Remove the pot from heat when the mixture turns golden brown. Keep stirring the mixture as it simmers. Once it reaches a smooth consistency and becomes a deep golden color, turn off the heat and move the pot to another burner. The consistency should be similar to hot syrup. If it's thick like honey, heat it a little longer.

steps.title: Pour the mixture into a bowl or jar and let it cool for 30 minutes.
steps.content: Pour the mixture into a bowl or jar and let it cool for 30 minutes. Unlike traditional hot wax, sugar wax should not be used hot. Pour it into a bowl or jar and give it about 30 minutes to cool down. If it still feels hot or warm enough to be uncomfortable, let it cool for several more minutes before proceeding. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Scoop up a small amount of wax with your fingers.
steps.content: Scoop up a small amount of wax with your fingers. The wax should still be warm but cool enough to touch, so you can use your fingers for the entire process. Scoop up a small amount and roll the wax into a ball with your hands. You can use a butter knife or a wooden popsicle stick instead of your hands, if you prefer.

steps.title: Apply the wax to a small strip of skin.
steps.content: Apply the wax to a small strip of skin. You can apply it with your fingers or a popsicle stick. Be sure to apply the wax in the opposite direction of hair growth. Spread it evenly until it's about 1/4 in (0.6 cm) thick. Work in small sections that are only a few inches in length and width. [6] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019. Yields enough wax for both legs (approximately)

steps.title: Take a deep breath and pull!
steps.content: Take a deep breath and pull! Get a firm grip on the wax with your fingers and pull it off in the opposite direction of your hair growth. Make it quick, just like you are pulling off a bandage. It may hurt a little bit! You can also use your fingers to roll or pull it off, but this prolongs the pain. It's better to make it quick. If desired, apply paper strips on top of the wax, smooth them out, and pull those off instead of the mixture itself.

steps.title: Continue to apply the wax in small sections until you're done.
steps.content: Continue to apply the wax in small sections until you're done. You can reuse the same piece of wax 3 to 4 times, if you like. Or you can use a fresh amount of wax for each section of skin. [7] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019.

steps.title: Pour any leftover wax into an airtight container and refrigerate it.
steps.content: Pour any leftover wax into an airtight container and refrigerate it. If you have leftover wax, pour it into an airtight container, like a sturdy plastic Tupperware container. Pop it in the fridge and use it within 4 to 5 weeks. Reheat it before you use it.

steps.title: Wash your skin with soap and water.
steps.content: Wash your skin with soap and water. Use warm water to open up your pores for a more pleasant, less painful waxing experience. Clean skin will also reduce your chances of getting infections, which are rare but worth being cautious about! [8] X Research source Opening up your pores also reduces the risk of ingrown hair .

steps.title: Exfoliate
steps.content: Exfoliate gently 2 days before treatment. Use a bristle brush or nylon glove to rub your skin in a circular motion. Exfoliating will ultimately make the sugar wax stick better, because sugar wax will lift up dead skin cells in addition to hair. If you remove some of the dead skin, the wax can just do its job and stick to the hair. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Moisturize your skin
steps.content: Moisturize your skin the night before the treatment. Lock in moisture to keep your skin and follicles healthy. [10] X Research source However, you don’t want to moisturize on the day of your sugar wax, because you want to start with clean skin. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Moisturize with natural oils, body butter, or serums.
steps.content: Moisturize with natural oils , body butter, or serums. You can moisturize immediately after waxing, as long as you’re not using harsh chemical products. Hydrating your skin keeps your skin smooth and free of ingrown hair. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Use a Dead Sea salt soak to alleviate itching.
steps.content: Use a Dead Sea salt soak to alleviate itching. You should avoid touching your skin too much after a sugar wax, so try a sea salt soak to reduce inflammation and itching. Dissolve 1/2 teaspoon (about 2.75 g) of Dead Sea salt in 2 fluid ounces (59 mL) of water. Soak a soft washcloth in the salt solution and hold it to the irritated area for 15 minutes. Then, rinse the area with clean water. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Exfoliate to prevent ingrown hairs.
steps.content: Exfoliate to prevent ingrown hairs. Wait 2 days after your sugar wax, then start exfoliating every 2-3 days. Use a gently-exfoliating serum, but don’t scrub hard–waxing has already removed the top layer of skin! [14] X Research source Try a coffee or sugar scrub instead of a brush for sensitive areas.

steps.title: Hold off on products that might irritate your skin.
steps.content: Hold off on products that might irritate your skin. Your skin will be pretty sensitive for 24 hours after sugaring, so steer clear of scented lotions, creams, and makeup (if you sugared your face). In addition, avoid harsh UV light and heat from saunas or steam treatments. Avoid deodorant if you sugared your armpits.
